description: This course introduces HCI user-centered practice. it will cover both theoretical and practical applications of Human-Computer Interaction concepts. It covers five interrelated themes: issue analysis, idea generation, prototype, implementation, and evaluation. It will teach you effective strategies for understanding people and recognizing design opportunities.
name: MAT 107 Introduction to Mathematics

description: This Standard Mandarin Chinese course is ideal for beginners with little or no prior knowledge. This course uses a communicative method to teach students essential Mandarin Chinese skills such as listening, speaking, reading, and writing. This course emphasizes language elements and incorporates traditional and modern cultural material.
name: CHI 103 Elementary Chinese

description: The course objective is : 1. Students can define software engineering words such as software life cycle and improvement models. 2. Students can use object-oriented design to identify classes, objects, and their relationships. 3. A student can comprehend UML diagrams for OO designs and transform them to code. 4. Students can code with ArrayLists/Vectors.
name: CSE 219 Object Oriented Programming & Data Structures

description: For the course, The main goal is to improve advanced reading comprehension, vocabulary, and discussion/presentation abilities. A variety of themes will be covered through reading, speaking, listening, and writing activities. The training emphasizes interpersonal, interpretative, and presentational communication abilities.
name: KOR 308 Third-year Korean I

description: This course introduces HCI user-centered practice. It will cover both theoretical and practical applications of Human-Computer Interaction concepts. It covers five interrelated themes: issue analysis, idea generation, prototype, implementation, and evaluation, and it will teach you effective strategies for understanding people and recognizing design opportunities.
name: COM 525 Introduction to Human Computer Interaction

description: a. Preparing to Play (grip, ready stance, mastering basic strokes and hand skills) b. Forehand and backhand strokes/lloops/ chops c. Understand topspin and underspin and footwork d. Execute serve and return e. Practicing match
name: PPE 208 Table Tennis II
